sentences.english: By then, she was being brainwashed daily.
sentences.chinese: 那个时候，她每天都被洗脑。

sentences.english: Parents begin brainwashing their children with this myth before they are out of grade school.
sentences.chinese: 在孩子毕业前，家长就开始给他们用这个神话洗脑。

sentences.english: Brainwashed of what they see happening around them?
sentences.chinese: 被洗脑了不相信身边发生的事？

sentences.english: They thought the religious sect was guilty of brainwashing.
sentences.chinese: 他们认为那个教派犯了洗脑的错误。

sentences.english: He's been brainwashed by the Invid.
Sheng-nan liu to destroy wash brain surgery and decided to get rid of the Tibet and fujimara digging holes.
sentences.chinese: 刘胜男为了彻底摧毁洗脑手术而决定除掉大藏和藤村。

sentences.english: Brainwashing didn't mean that they are psychotic.
sentences.chinese: 被洗脑不表示他们有精神病。

sentences.english: Critics say the mass weddings prove the church brainwashes its followers.
sentences.chinese: 批评家说集体婚礼证明了教堂对它的信徒进行洗脑。

sentences.english: When we are silent no more, you say we are brainwashed xenophobes.
sentences.chinese: 当我们不再沉默，你却将我们描绘被洗脑的仇外者。

sentences.english: It is universally considered proper to prevent unformed minds to be brainwashed.
sentences.chinese: 普遍认为保护未定型的头脑免受洗脑是正确的选择。

sentences.english: The enemy brainwashed all its prisoners in special cells.
sentences.chinese: 敌人给住在特别单人牢房里的所有战俘洗脑。

sentences.english: I mean, you can't really call it brainwash.
Brainwashed by somebody? I find it hard to believe.
sentences.chinese: 就被别人洗脑了？，我觉得这难以相信。

sentences.english: People become brainwashed by the media in the most basic ways.
sentences.chinese: 媒体采用基本的方法就可以对人们洗脑。

sentences.english: Interpreting:"What's behind the website like this is a result of education polity which brainwashes."
sentences.chinese: 这种网站其实是洗脑教育政策的结果。

sentences.english: The experiments there were described by one informant as" brainwashing with chemicals".
sentences.chinese: 实验被一个密告者描述为用“化学药物洗脑”。

definition: to rock/to sway/to flicker (e.g. of lights reflected on water)/to flutter (e.g. of a flag)/to trick sb into doing sth/to dupe/to con
to imbue with/to inculcate/to instill into/to teach/to impart/to channel water to another place
to proclaim/to make public or well known
lit. to inject chicken blood/(coll.) extremely excited or energetic (often used mockingly)
to make a fool out of/to fool/to dupe
